elements.name: plus-animation
elements.description: Creates an animation and applies it to the content. Powered by the [Web Animations API](https://mdn.io/web-animations-api). A wide range of animations is available [here](https://www.htmlplus.io/component/animation/names).

events.name: plus-cancel
events.description: Fires when the [Animation.cancel()](https://mdn.io/animation-cancel)method is called or when the animation enters the "`idle`" play state from another state.

events.name: plus-finish
events.description: Fires when the animation finishes playing.

events.name: plus-remove
events.description: Fires when the animation is removed (i.e., put into an `active` replace state).

properties.name: composite
properties.description: Determines how values are combined between this animation and other,separate animations that do not specify their own specific composite operation.

properties.name: delay
properties.description: The number of milliseconds to delay the start of the animation.

properties.name: direction
properties.description: Whether the animation runs forwards (`normal`), backwards (`reverse`),switches direction after each iteration (`alternate`), or runsbackwards and switches direction after each iteration (`alternate-reverse`).

properties.name: duration
properties.description: The number of milliseconds each iteration of the animation takes to complete.Keep in mind that your animation will not run if this value is 0.

properties.name: easing
properties.description: The rate of the animation's change over time.Accepts the pre-defined values "`linear`", "`ease`", "`ease-in`", "`ease-out`", and "`ease-in-out`",or a custom "`cubic-bezier`" value like "`cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 0.58, 1)`".

properties.name: endDelay
properties.description: The number of milliseconds to delay after the end of an animation.This is primarily of use when sequencing animations based on the end time of another animation.

properties.name: fill
properties.description: Dictates whether the animation's effects should be reflected by the element(s)prior to playing ("`backwards`"), retained after the animation has completedplaying ("`forwards`"), or `both`.

properties.name: instance
properties.description: The [Animation](https://mdn.io/api-animation) object instance.

properties.name: iterationComposite
properties.description: Determines how values build from iteration to iteration in this animation.Can be set to `accumulate` or `replace`.

properties.name: iterations
properties.description: The number of times the animation should repeat. And can also take a value of[Infinity](https://mdn.io/infinity)to make it repeat for as long as the element exists.

properties.name: iterationStart
properties.description: Describes at what point in the iteration the animation should start.0.5 would indicate starting halfway through the first iteration for example,and with this value set, an animation with 2 iterations would end halfway througha third iteration.

properties.name: keyframes
properties.description: A [keyframes](https://mdn.io/keyframe-formats)object or `null`.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Specifies what kind of animation will play.The list of available animations is [here](/component/animation/names).

properties.name: playbackRate
properties.description: Sets the animation's playback rate.

properties.name: run
properties.description: Starts the animation.

properties.name: cancel
properties.description: Clears all [keyframeEffects](https://mdn.io/keyframe-effect)caused by this animation and aborts its playback.

properties.name: commitStyles
properties.description: Commits the end styling state of an animation to the element being animated, even after thatanimation has been removed. It will cause the end styling state to be written to the elementbeing animated, in the form of properties inside a `style` attribute.

properties.name: finish
properties.description: Seeks either end of an animation, depending on whether the animation is playing or reversing.

properties.name: pause
properties.description: Suspends playing of an animation.

properties.name: persist
properties.description: Explicitly persists an animation, when it would otherwise be removed due to the browser's[Automatically removing filling animations](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation#automatically_removing_filling_animations)behavior.

properties.name: play
properties.description: Starts or resumes playing of an animation, or begins the animation again if it previously finished.

properties.name: reverse
properties.description: Reverses playback direction, stopping at the start of the animation.If the animation is finished or unplayed, it will play from end to beginning.

properties.name: updatePlaybackRate
properties.description: Sets the speed of an animation after first synchronizing its playback position.

attributes.name: composite
attributes.description: Determines how values are combined between this animation and other,separate animations that do not specify their own specific composite operation.

attributes.name: delay
attributes.description: The number of milliseconds to delay the start of the animation.

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description: Whether the animation runs forwards (`normal`), backwards (`reverse`),switches direction after each iteration (`alternate`), or runsbackwards and switches direction after each iteration (`alternate-reverse`).

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description: The number of milliseconds each iteration of the animation takes to complete.Keep in mind that your animation will not run if this value is 0.

attributes.name: easing
attributes.description: The rate of the animation's change over time.Accepts the pre-defined values "`linear`", "`ease`", "`ease-in`", "`ease-out`", and "`ease-in-out`",or a custom "`cubic-bezier`" value like "`cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 0.58, 1)`".

attributes.name: end-delay
attributes.description: The number of milliseconds to delay after the end of an animation.This is primarily of use when sequencing animations based on the end time of another animation.

attributes.name: fill
attributes.description: Dictates whether the animation's effects should be reflected by the element(s)prior to playing ("`backwards`"), retained after the animation has completedplaying ("`forwards`"), or `both`.

attributes.name: instance
attributes.description: The [Animation](https://mdn.io/api-animation) object instance.

attributes.name: iteration-composite
attributes.description: Determines how values build from iteration to iteration in this animation.Can be set to `accumulate` or `replace`.

attributes.name: iterations
attributes.description: The number of times the animation should repeat. And can also take a value of[Infinity](https://mdn.io/infinity)to make it repeat for as long as the element exists.

attributes.name: iteration-start
attributes.description: Describes at what point in the iteration the animation should start.0.5 would indicate starting halfway through the first iteration for example,and with this value set, an animation with 2 iterations would end halfway througha third iteration.

attributes.name: keyframes
attributes.description: A [keyframes](https://mdn.io/keyframe-formats)object or `null`.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Specifies what kind of animation will play.The list of available animations is [here](/component/animation/names).

attributes.name: playback-rate
attributes.description: Sets the animation's playback rate.

attributes.name: run
attributes.description: Starts the animation.

elements.name: plus-breadcrumb
elements.description: Breadcrumb component is a navigation pattern that shows the actual path of the current page.

properties.name: expanderText
properties.description: Specifies the label for the expander button.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Specifies the position of the expander button.The expander button is displayed when the number of items reached the maximum limit.

properties.name: max
properties.description: Specifies the Maximum number of items that are allowed to be displayed.

properties.name: separator
properties.description: Specifies the separator between items.

attributes.description: Specifies the label for the expander button.

attributes.name: separator
attributes.description: Specifies the separator between items.

elements.name: plus-browse
elements.description: Allows you to select file or files by using click or drag & drop functionality.

events.name: plus-change
events.description: Fires when file(s) are selected.

events.name: plus-error
events.description: Fires when selected invalid file(s).

events.name: plus-success
events.description: Fires when file(s) are added successfully.

properties.name: accept
properties.description: One or more[unique file type specifiers](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/file#unique_file_type_specifiers)describing file types to allow.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Disables the component functionality.

properties.name: droppable
properties.description: Adds droppable ability.

properties.name: min
properties.description: Specifies the minimum number of files.

properties.name: max
properties.description: Specifies the maximum number of files.

properties.name: minSize
properties.description: Specifies the minimum size of the file(s) in bytes.

properties.name: maxSize
properties.description: Specifies the maximum size of the file(s) in bytes.

properties.name: multiple
properties.description: Allows to select more than one file.

properties.name: browse
properties.description: Opens the browse dialog.

attributes.name: accept
attributes.description: One or more[unique file type specifiers](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/file#unique_file_type_specifiers)describing file types to allow.

attributes.name: droppable

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: Specifies the minimum number of files.

attributes.name: max

attributes.name: min-size
attributes.description: Specifies the minimum size of the file(s) in bytes.

attributes.name: max-size
attributes.description: Specifies the maximum size of the file(s) in bytes.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: Allows to select more than one file.

elements.name: plus-card
elements.description: Cards contain content and actions about a single subject.

properties.name: elevation
properties.description: If you want the card to have shadow, use the elevation property,And select the property value between `1` and `24`.

properties.name: flat
properties.description: Use the flat property to neutralize elevation.

properties.name: outlined
properties.description: If you want the card to have border, use the outlined property.

properties.name: tile
properties.description: Use tile property to neutralize border-radius.

attributes.name: elevation
attributes.description: If you want the card to have shadow, use the elevation property,And select the property value between `1` and `24`.

attributes.name: flat
attributes.description: Use the flat property to neutralize elevation.

attributes.name: outlined
attributes.description: If you want the card to have border, use the outlined property.

attributes.name: tile
attributes.description: Use tile property to neutralize border-radius.

elements.name: plus-center
elements.description: Centers content vertically and horizontally.

properties.name: inline
properties.description: Converts the `display` CSS property from `flex` to `inline-flex`.

attributes.name: inline
attributes.description: Converts the `display` CSS property from `flex` to `inline-flex`.

elements.name: plus-click-outside
elements.description: Detects when a click event happens outside of itself.

events.description: Fires when outside of the component is clicked.

properties.name: capture
properties.description: A boolean value indicating that events of this type will be dispatched to the registered`listener` before being dispatched to any `EventTarget` beneath it in the DOM tree.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Disables the component functionality.

properties.name: once
properties.description: The event fires only once.

elements.name: plus-cropper
elements.description: Used for cropping large images to fit a container before uploading them to the server.

events.name: plus-crop
events.description: Fires when the `image` or the `viewport` is changed.

events.name: plus-crop-end
events.description: Fires when the `image` or the `viewport` changes are finished.

events.name: plus-crop-move
events.description: Fires when the `image` or the `viewport` is changing.

events.name: plus-crop-start
events.description: Fires when the `image` or the `viewport` starts to change.

events.name: plus-ready
events.description: Fires when the image has been loaded and the component is ready for operation.

events.name: plus-zoom
events.description: Fires when the component starts to `zoom in` or `zoom out`.

properties.name: area
properties.description: A number between 0 and 1. Specifies the automatic cropping area size.

properties.name: aspectRatio
properties.description: Specifies the initial aspect ratio of the viewport.

properties.name: backdrop
properties.description: Shows the black modal above the image and under the viewport.

properties.name: background
properties.description: Shows the grid background of the container.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Disables the component functionality.

properties.name: guides
properties.description: Shows the dashed lines above the viewport.

properties.name: indicator
properties.description: Shows the center indicator above the viewport.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: Specifies the mode.

properties.name: resizer
properties.description: Enables to resize the viewport by dragging (Works when the value of the `mode` property is `crop`).

properties.name: resizerShape
properties.description: Specifies the shape of the resizer.

properties.name: responsive
properties.description: Re-renders when resizing the window.

properties.name: shape
properties.description: Specifies the shape of the viewport.

properties.name: src
properties.description: Specifies the image's src.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Gets/Sets data.

properties.name: view
properties.description: Specifies the view.

properties.name: zoomable
properties.description: Enables to zoom the image.

properties.name: zoomRatio
properties.description: Specifies zoom ratio when zooming the image by wheeling the mouse.

properties.name: flipX
properties.description: Flips horizontally.

properties.name: flipY
properties.description: Flips vertically.

properties.name: move
properties.description: Moves the canvas with relative offsets.

properties.name: moveTo
properties.description: Moves the canvas to an absolute point.

properties.name: reset
properties.description: Resets the image and viewport to their initial states.

properties.name: rotate
properties.description: Rotates the image with a relative degree.

properties.name: rotateTo
properties.description: Rotates the image to an absolute degree.

properties.name: toCanvas
properties.description: Gets `canvas` from the cropped image.

properties.name: zoom
properties.description: Zooms the canvas with a relative ratio.

properties.name: zoomTo
properties.description: Zooms the canvas to an absolute ratio.

attributes.name: area
attributes.description: A number between 0 and 1. Specifies the automatic cropping area size.

attributes.name: aspect-ratio
attributes.description: Specifies the initial aspect ratio of the viewport.

attributes.name: backdrop
attributes.description: Shows the black modal above the image and under the viewport.

attributes.name: background
attributes.description: Shows the grid background of the container.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the component functionality.

attributes.name: guides
attributes.description: Shows the dashed lines above the viewport.

attributes.name: indicator
attributes.description: Shows the center indicator above the viewport.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: Specifies the mode.

attributes.name: resizer
attributes.description: Enables to resize the viewport by dragging (Works when the value of the `mode` property is `crop`).

attributes.name: resizer-shape
attributes.description: Specifies the shape of the resizer.

attributes.name: responsive
attributes.description: Re-renders when resizing the window.

attributes.name: shape
attributes.description: Specifies the shape of the viewport.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Specifies the image's src.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Gets/Sets data.

attributes.name: view
attributes.description: Specifies the view.

attributes.name: zoomable
attributes.description: Enables to zoom the image.

attributes.name: zoom-ratio
attributes.description: Specifies zoom ratio when zooming the image by wheeling the mouse.

elements.name: plus-dialog
elements.description: A dialog is a `conversation` between the system and the user. It is prompted when the system needs input from the user or to give the user urgent information concerning their current workflow.

events.name: plus-close
events.description: When the dialog is going to hide

events.name: plus-closed
events.description: When the dialog is completely closed and its animation is completed.

events.name: plus-open
events.description: When the dialog is going to show this event triggers

events.name: plus-opened
events.description: When the dialog is completely shown and its animation is completed.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: TODO

properties.name: backdrop
properties.description: Activate the dialog's backdrop to show or not.

properties.name: connector
properties.description: This property helps you to attach which dialog toggler controls the dialog.It doesn't matter where the dialog toggler is.You can put the dialog's toggler inside or outside of the dialog.Read more about connectors [here](/connector).

properties.name: fullHeight
properties.description: Set the height of the dialog as much as the screen's height.

properties.name: fullWidth
properties.description: Set the width of the dialog as much as the screen's width.

properties.name: fullscreen
properties.description: Set both width and height of the dialog to occupy the screen size.

properties.name: keyboard
properties.description: Closes the dialog when `escape` key is pressed.

properties.name: open
properties.description: Control dialog to show or not.

properties.name: persistent
properties.description: It prevents the dialog from closing on clicking outside of the element.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: Specifies where to show the dialog box by choosing two values, one for horizontal and another for vertical.Horizontal has a range of `left`, `center`, `right`, `start`, `end`, and vertical values are `top`, `center` and `bottom`.

properties.name: portal
properties.description: Enables or disables the portal.

properties.name: portalStrategy
properties.description: Specifies the position of the dialog.

properties.name: portalTarget
properties.description: Specifies the position of the dialog relative to the target.

properties.name: scrollable
properties.description: It makes the user able to scroll the content by adding a scroll beside it.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Determine the width of the dialog.

properties.name: sticky
properties.description: Removes the margin around the dialog's content.

attributes.description: TODO

attributes.description: Activate the dialog's backdrop to show or not.

attributes.description: Set the height of the dialog as much as the screen's height.

properties.description: This property helps you to attach which dialog this toggler controls.It doesn't matter where the dialog toggler is.You can put the dialog's toggler inside or outside of the dialog.Read more about connectors [here](/connector).

elements.name: plus-divider
elements.description: A thin line that divides the content vertically or horizontally.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: Specifies the location of the default slot.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Specifies the width of the border.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Specifies the style of the border.

properties.name: variant
properties.description: Specifies the amount of indentation.

properties.name: vertical
properties.description: Draws the divider in a vertical orientation.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description: Specifies the location of the default slot.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Specifies the width of the border.

elements.name: plus-drawer
elements.description: This component lets you add collapsible side contents like navigation alongside some primary content.

events.name: plus-close
events.description: When the drawer is going to hide

events.name: plus-closed
events.description: When the drawer is completely closed and its animation is completed.

events.name: plus-open
events.description: When the drawer is going to show this event triggers

events.name: plus-opened
events.description: When the drawer is completely shown and its animation is completed.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: TODO

properties.name: backdrop
properties.description: Activate the drawer's backdrop to show or not.

properties.name: breakpoint
properties.description: Sets the mobile breakpoint to apply alternate styles for mobile deviceswhen the breakpoint value is met.

properties.name: connector
properties.description: This property helps you to attach which drawer toggler controls the drawer.It doesn't matter where the drawer toggler is.You can put the drawer's toggler inside or outside of the drawer.Read more about connectors [here](/connector).

properties.name: mini
properties.description: Set the width of drawer to the minimum size you specified for the `mini-size` property.

properties.name: miniSize
properties.description: Sets the minimum width size of the drawer.

properties.name: open
properties.description: Control drawer to show or not.

properties.name: persistent
properties.description: If true, don't allow the drawer to be closed by clicking outside of the drawer.If false, the drawer will be closed by clicking outside of it.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: Specifies where the drawer will open.

properties.name: flexible
properties.description: It controls the flexibility of the drawer's width. If yes, the width of the drawer can be reduced.If false doesn't allow the width of the drawer to reduce.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Determine the width of the drawer.

properties.name: temporary
properties.description: On default the drawer is considered as a part of the main container.it pushes the other contents on opening.If true it will be opened over other contents and doesn't affect other contents.A temporary drawer sits above its application and uses a backdrop to darken the background.

attributes.description: TODO

attributes.name: backdrop
attributes.description: Activate the drawer's backdrop to show or not.

attributes.name: breakpoint
attributes.description: Sets the mobile breakpoint to apply alternate styles for mobile deviceswhen the breakpoint value is met.

attributes.name: connector
attributes.description: This property helps you to attach which drawer toggler controls the drawer.It doesn't matter where the drawer toggler is.You can put the drawer's toggler inside or outside of the drawer.Read more about connectors [here](/connector).

attributes.name: mini
attributes.description: Set the width of drawer to the minimum size you specified for the `mini-size` property.

attributes.name: mini-size
attributes.description: Sets the minimum width size of the drawer.

attributes.name: open

attributes.name: flexible

attributes.name: size

attributes.name: temporary
attributes.description: On default the drawer is considered as a part of the main container.it pushes the other contents on opening.If true it will be opened over other contents and doesn't affect other contents.A temporary drawer sits above its application and uses a backdrop to darken the background.

properties.name: connector
properties.description: This property helps you to attach which drawer this toggler controls.It doesn't matter where the drawer toggler is.You can put the drawer's toggler inside or outside of the drawer.Read more about connectors [here](/connector).

attributes.name: connector
attributes.description: This property helps you to attach which drawer this toggler controls.It doesn't matter where the drawer toggler is.You can put the drawer's toggler inside or outside of the drawer.Read more about connectors [here](/connector).

properties.name: arguments

elements.name: plus-floating
elements.description: A component that appears in front of all screen content.

properties.name: fixed
properties.description: Positions the element relative to the viewport and prevents it from moving even when scrolled.Otherwise, the element is positioned relative to its nearest ancestor.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Specifies the deviation from the center.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: Specifies the display location.

elements.name: plus-format-bytes
elements.description: Converts bytes to a human-readable string. [Metric and IEC](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Gigabyte) standard are supported.

properties.name: display
properties.description: Specifies the unit will be shown as an abbreviation or not.

properties.name: locale
properties.description: Localizes the result. [More](https://mdn.io/number-format/constructor).

properties.name: decimals
properties.description: Specifies the number of decimal places.Use an array to specify the minimum and maximum.

properties.name: separator
properties.description: Specifies the separator between number and unit.

properties.name: signed
properties.description: Shows plus sign for positive numbers.If the difference is exactly zero a space character will be prepended instead for better alignment.

properties.name: standard
properties.description: Specifies the standard of units.[Metric and IEC](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Gigabyte) are supported.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: Specifies the unit in which the result will be returned.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The bytes value to convert.

elements.name: plus-grid
elements.description: It's the most flexible and powerful grid system which you need to build simple to complex responsive layouts, using two main components, `plus-grid` as a container & `plus-grid-item`. By using these components, align your content in any form & shape and for all screen sizes with 12 available column sizes and 6 breakpoints.

properties.name: alignContent
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically across all rows (It overrides alignItems).

properties.name: alignContentXs
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically across all rows for extra-small display sizes(It overrides alignItemsXs).

properties.name: alignContentSm
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically across all rows for small display sizes(It overrides alignItemsSm).

properties.name: alignContentMd
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically across all rows for medium display sizes(It overrides alignItemsMd).

properties.name: alignContentLg
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically across all rows for large display sizes(It overrides alignItemsLg).

properties.name: alignContentXl
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically across all rows for extra-large display sizes(It overrides alignItemsXl).

properties.name: alignContentXxl
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically across all rows for extra-extra-large display sizes(It overrides alignItemsXXl).

properties.name: alignItems
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically inside their own row.

properties.name: alignItemsXs
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically inside their own row for extra-small display sizes.

properties.name: alignItemsSm
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically inside their own row for small display sizes.

properties.name: alignItemsMd
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically inside their own row for medium display sizes.

properties.name: alignItemsLg
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically inside their own row for large display sizes.

properties.name: alignItemsXl
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically inside their own row for extra-large display sizes.

properties.name: alignItemsXxl
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically inside their own row for extra-extra-large display sizes.

properties.name: gutter
properties.description: Adds a gap between contents to make space between them vertically and horizontally.

properties.name: gutterX
properties.description: Adds a gap between contents to make space between them horizontally.

properties.name: gutterY
properties.description: Adds a gap between contents to make space between them vertically.

properties.name: justifyContent
properties.description: Justifies contents horizontally.

properties.name: justifyContentXs
properties.description: Justifies contents horizontally for extra-small display sizes.

properties.name: justifyContentSm
properties.description: Justifies contents horizontally for small display sizes.

properties.name: justifyContentMd
properties.description: Justifies contents horizontally for medium display sizes.

properties.name: justifyContentLg
properties.description: Justifies contents horizontally for large display sizes.

properties.name: justifyContentXl
properties.description: Justifies contents horizontally for extra-large display sizes.

properties.name: justifyContentXxl
properties.description: Justifies contents horizontally for extra-extra-large display sizes.

properties.name: reverse
properties.description: Reverses the flow of contents from left-to-right to right-to-left, or vice-versa.

properties.name: vertical
properties.description: Changes the flow of contents from left-to-right to top-to-down.

properties.name: wrap
properties.description: Controls allowing the container to wrap the content or not if the cumulative widthsize of contents is more than the twelve-column width.

properties.name: wrapXs
properties.description: Controls allowing the container to wrap the content or not if the cumulative widthsize of contents is more than the twelve-column width for extra-small screen devices.

properties.name: wrapSm

properties.name: alignSelf
properties.description: Aligns the grid-item vertically in its container (grid).It overrides the align-items property of its parent.

properties.name: alignSelfXs
properties.description: Aligns the grid-item vertically in its container (grid) for extra-small display sizes.It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified.(It overrides the align-items property of its parent just for extra-small breakpoints).

properties.name: alignSelfSm
properties.description: Aligns the grid-item vertically in its container (grid) for small display sizes.It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified.(It overrides the align-items property of its parent just for small breakpoints).

properties.name: alignSelfMd
properties.description: Aligns the grid-item vertically in its container (grid) for medium display sizes.It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified.(It overrides the align-items property of its parent just for medium breakpoints).

properties.name: alignSelfLg
properties.description: Aligns the grid-item vertically in its container (grid) for large display sizes.It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified.(It overrides the align-items property of its parent just for large breakpoints).

properties.name: alignSelfXl
properties.description: Aligns the grid-item vertically in its container (grid) for extra-large display sizes.It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified.(It overrides the align-items property of its parent just for extra-large breakpoints).

properties.name: alignSelfXxl
properties.description: Aligns the grid-item vertically in its container (grid) for extra-extra-large display sizes.It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified.(It overrides the align-items property of its parent just for extra-extra-large breakpoints).

properties.name: xs
properties.description: Specifies the number of columns for extra-small viewports (portrait phones).It also determines the number of columns for bigger display sizes whenother upper breakpoints (sm, md, lg, xl and xxl) are not specified.

properties.name: sm
properties.description: Specifies the number of columns for small viewports (landscape phones).It also determines the number of columns for bigger display sizes whenother upper breakpoints (md, lg, xl and xxl) are not specified.

properties.name: md
properties.description: Specifies the number of columns for medium viewports (tablets).It also determines the number of columns for bigger display sizes whenother upper breakpoints (lg, xl and xxl) are not specified.

properties.name: lg
properties.description: Specifies the number of columns for large viewports (desktop).It also determines the number of columns for bigger display sizes whenthe upper breakpoint (xl and xxl) is not specified.

properties.name: xl
properties.description: Specifies the number of columns for large viewports (large desktops).It also determines the number of columns for bigger display sizes whenthe upper breakpoint (xxl) is not specified.

properties.name: xxl
properties.description: Specifies the number of columns for extra-extra-large viewports (larger desktops).

properties.name: hideXs
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in extra-small display sizes (portrait phones).

properties.name: hideSm
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in small display sizes (landscape phones).

properties.name: hideMd
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in medium display sizes (tablets).

properties.name: hideLg
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in large display sizes (desktop).

properties.name: hideXl
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in extra-large display sizes (large desktops).

properties.name: hideXxl
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in extra-extra-large display sizes (larger desktops).

properties.name: hide
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in all display sizes.

properties.description: Hides the grid-item in small and larger display sizes.

properties.name: hideMdUp
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in medium and larger display sizes.

properties.name: hideLgUp
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in large and larger display sizes.

properties.name: hideXlUp
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in large and larger display sizes.

properties.description: Hides the grid-item in large and smaller display sizes.

properties.name: offsetXs
properties.description: Adds an offset space before the grid-item for extra-small display sizes.It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified.

properties.name: offsetSm
properties.description: Adds an offset space before the grid-item for small display sizes.It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified.

properties.name: offsetMd
properties.description: Adds an offset space before the grid-item for medium display sizes.It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified.

properties.name: offsetLg
properties.description: Adds an offset space before the grid-item for large display sizes.It also applies to the larger breakpoint (xl) while that is not specified.

properties.name: offsetXl
properties.description: Adds an offset space before the grid-item for extra-large display sizes.

properties.name: offsetXxl
properties.description: Adds an offset space before the grid-item for extra-extra-large display sizes.

properties.name: orderXs
properties.description: Overrides the default order of the grid-item for extra-small display sizes.It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified.

elements.name: plus-icon

elements.name: plus-intersection
elements.description: The [Intersection Observer API](https://mdn.io/intersection-observer-api) provides a way to asynchronously observe changes in the intersection of a target element with an ancestor element or with a top-level document's [viewport](https://mdn.io/glossary-viewport).

events.name: plus-change
events.description: Fires When the browser detects that the component has been unveiled or obscured.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Disables the component functionality.

properties.name: once
properties.description: The event fires only once.

properties.name: root
properties.description: The element that is used as the viewport for checking visibility of the target. Must be theancestor of the target. Defaults to the browser viewport if not specified or if `null`.

properties.name: rootMargin
properties.description: Margin around the root. Can have values similar to the CSS[margin](https://mdn.io/margin)property, e.g. `"10px 20px 30px 40px"` (top, right, bottom, left). The values can bepercentages. This set of values serves to grow or shrink each side of the root element'sbounding box before computing intersections. Defaults to all zeros.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: Either a single number or an array of numbers which indicate at what percentage of thetarget's visibility the observer's callback should be executed. If you only want to detectwhen visibility passes the 50% mark, you can use a value of 0.5. If you want the callback torun every time visibility passes another 25%, you would specify the array[0, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1]. The default is 0 (meaning as soon as even one pixel is visible, thecallback will be run). A value of 1.0 means that the threshold isn't considered passed untilevery pixel is visible.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the component functionality.

attributes.name: once
attributes.description: The event fires only once.

attributes.name: root
attributes.description: The element that is used as the viewport for checking visibility of the target. Must be theancestor of the target. Defaults to the browser viewport if not specified or if `null`.

attributes.name: root-margin
attributes.description: Margin around the root. Can have values similar to the CSS[margin](https://mdn.io/margin)property, e.g. `"10px 20px 30px 40px"` (top, right, bottom, left). The values can bepercentages. This set of values serves to grow or shrink each side of the root element'sbounding box before computing intersections. Defaults to all zeros.

attributes.name: threshold
attributes.description: Either a single number or an array of numbers which indicate at what percentage of thetarget's visibility the observer's callback should be executed. If you only want to detectwhen visibility passes the 50% mark, you can use a value of 0.5. If you want the callback torun every time visibility passes another 25%, you would specify the array[0, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1]. The default is 0 (meaning as soon as even one pixel is visible, thecallback will be run). A value of 1.0 means that the threshold isn't considered passed untilevery pixel is visible.
